sentences: Kõige huvitavam inimene, keda eales olen tundnud.
Ole täna nii lõbus, kui eales suudad!
context: The word 'suudad' appears to be a form of the Estonian verb 'suda', which means 'to manage', 'to succeed', or 'to be able'. In the context of the example sentence 'Ole täna nii lõbus, kui eales suudad!', it's used in the present tense 2nd person singular form meaning '(you) can' or '(you) are able to'. It's often used with 'eales' (ever/never) to express maximum capability - 'as fun as you ever can be'.
